channel.title: Code too large

item.title: Code too large
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:5, topic:513160”]What does he mean? he want to add a new object handler? if he do i tell you how i do it on my delta:

public void loadO(int objectId){ switch(objectId){ case object1: //code(); break; case object2: //code(); break; } } Then on case 132: add this: loadO(objectID);[/quote]my eyes are bleeding

item.title: Code too large
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

What does he mean? he want to add a new object handler? if he do i tell you how i do it on my delta:

public void loadO(int objectId){ switch(objectId){ case object1: //code(); break; case object2: //code(); break; } } Then on case 132: add this: loadO(objectID);

Read full topic

item.title: Code too large
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

make a handler for that and then call it in the packet.
example

/**
 *@author
 */
public class DropPartyHandler {     
    /*
     *All the shit before your stuff
     */


    /*
     *Extends packets or whatever
     */
      public void dropParty(int objectID) {
          switch(objectID) {
          //Here is where you add the code you provided us.
          }
      }
}

So once you have your handler go to the firstclickobject packet 132.
And call it.
DropPartyHandler.dropParty(objectID);

i might have missed something but thats about it.

Read full topic

sendQuest(“Public(Annouce multiple times, Cost: 5m)”, 2483);
sendQuest(“Big Ass Party(Teleport Everyone, Cost: 100m)”, 2484);
